poem:
"Contemplations on Resilient Justice"

In the crisp morning,
the gray courthouses whisper,
questioning power's reach -
How far can truth be stretched,
before breaking?

In the still air,
Autumnal dissent sprouts -
overturning boundaries drawn
in temporal sand.

Three sentinels stand,
in the labyrinth of law,
their scepticism a beating drum -
echoing,
in the chambers of power,
an audacious melody of 
vindication.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Judges skeptical of Trump’s presidential immunity arguments in election interference case A federal appeals court on Tuesday signaled it would reject Donald Trump’s arguments that he cannot be criminally prosecuted for his efforts to overturn the 2020 election results because it involved actions he took while president, questioning such an expansive view of executive power. The three-judge panel at the US court of appeals for the DC circuit expressed particular skepticism with the position that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
